articles.title: World Cup: European nations scrap One Love armbands plan due to fear of Fifa sanctions - The Irish Times
articles.description: Prospect of captains receiving yellow cards sees nations back down over armband stance
articles.content: England, Belgium, Netherlands, Switzerland, Germany, Denmark and Wales will not wear an anti-discrimination armband in their World Cup matches on Monday after Fifa threatened them with sporting sanct… [+1601 chars]

articles.author: George Ramsay, Zayn Nabbi
articles.title: England's Harry Kane and several other European captains told not to wear 'OneLove' armband at World Cup - CNN
articles.description: The captains of several European countries will not to wear "OneLove" armbands at the World Cup in Qatar due to the danger of receiving yellow cards.
articles.content:
The captains of several European teams will not to wear OneLove armbands at the World Cup in Qatar due to the danger of receiving yellow cards.

articles.title: Top Russian official warns of possible nuclear accident at Zaporizhzhia - Reuters
articles.description: The head of Russia's state-run atomic energy agency, Rosatom, warned on Monday there was a risk of a nuclear accident at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, Europe's largest, following renewed shelling over the weekend.
articles.content: LONDON, Nov 21 (Reuters) - The head of Russia's state-run atomic energy agency, Rosatom, warned on Monday there was a risk of a nuclear accident at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, Europe's larg… [+1478 chars]

articles.title: Mortgage fixed rates Ireland: Homeowners warned not to panic as huge gap emerges in fixed rates on offer - Independent.ie
articles.description: MORTGAGE holders who want to lock in to a fixed rate to avoid surging European interest rises have been warned not to be panicked into signing up for the wrong rate.
